content.description: This short and somewhat contrived problem resides on the far right side of the Meteorite boulder. Start with an undercling, a jug and a poor, high foot and move up and right.
content.location: Far right side of the meteorite boulder. See photo.

content.description: This problem is on the middle-right side of the Meteorite boulder and starts with two good handholds and moves directly up. The feet make this one challenging.
content.location: Middle-right side of the Meteorite boulder. See photo.

content.description: This route is in the middle of the Meteorite Boulder. It starts with a match on a solid handhold and moves up and left to a decent rail.

Start with hands matched on a good sloper rail (or pinch if your hand is big enough).  Find a side-pull on the left and then another better side-pull on the right.  Once you have the right, make a big reach to the juggy flake out left.  Top out straight up.
content.protection: The problem is low and the landing is flat and level, so not much to worry about in the way of ankle rollers.  A pad should be fine, but a good spotter is always welcome.
content.location: This problem is situated between problems 1 and 2 on the Meteorite Boulder's south face (the face the Hillside Trail runs past).

content.description: The first route on the Meteorite Boulder, this one starts on the far left of the boulder with two obvious handholds (marked in the photo). Move straight up without using the massive flake on the right.

This great traverse starts on the right side of the Meteorite Boulder. Right hand on the obvious good rounded hold (start of green dotted line in pic), left hand in the first incut edge. Traverse left with good hands and poor feet to reach the solid match in the middle of the boulder. The crux is moving around the bulge with the crack underneath it. Using the small rail at the top of the bulge is considered off route. With the rail, the traverse ends early at V1/2. Continue past the bulge and finish with a lieback on the juggy flake, or go all the way around to do the fun low traverse on the back side.
